column1: 0$Depression$6/5/2012 10:21:38 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has been a godsend
column2: it has kept me sane & helped me sleep for over 15 years. I have suffered from depression my entire adult life & spent a decade trying everything with limited success. I hated sleeping all my life as I have horrible nightmares & sleepwalk. It's hard to say how much of the depression was a result of insomnia
column3: but whatever the reasons this has really helped. I am reassured by the fact that it has been around for over 50 years.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been on this drug for 38 years. I tried different anti-depressant drugs before Tofranil PM.  None worked.  Once I started taking Tofranil PM I could ""feel"" my spirits lift.  The change came within 30 days.  It was an incredible feeling.  I was depressed and also had panic attacks.  I couldn't leave my home.  I was living in hell. This drug was my lifesaver.  I tried different times to get off the drug but I would return to .  There is something lacking in me that this drug keeps me on an even keel.  Now that I am on Medicare
column3: my prescription drug plan does not cover this drug.  It is going to cost me almost $5000 a year to continue taking this drug.  Without it
column4: I am not myself. Why should prescription drug plans tell you what drug you need when they don't have a clue about past experiences with the drug?"

column1: 3$Depression$7/6/2010 12:28:27 PM$Reviewer: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have taken this medication for endogenous depression for close to thirty years. It has been a life saver for me.
5$Depression$1/6/2010 7:22:11 PM$Reviewer: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$5$"

I have been taking Tofranil-PM for over 20 years and it has saved my quality of life.  I had severe depression and anxiety attacks that kept me at home.  I think I would have committed suicide if I had not found help."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$3$4$I am not real sure if this is gonna help me.. it makes me sleep alot! I do get a good nights rest
column3: but then all the next day all I want to do is sleep... it has made me not want to eat
column4: and so I have to make myself eat.. I still feel depressed
column5: but maybe it hasnt been in my system long enough.. anyone else on this for depression? please let me know... thanks!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I had depression off and on since my early 20's. In my 30's I was so depressed I could not fuction.
just out of medical school
column3: told me he thought I had biological depression and asked me to try Tofranil. In about a week I was no longer depressed. I have tried to get off the drug several times but each time I get down to 150mg my depression starts up again.

column1: I am now 70 years old and maintain on 200mg at bedtime. I have no sign of depression and have appropriate reactions. My life would not be worth living without Tofranil. The few side effects I have are a small price to pay. This drug has saved my life."

55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I suffered with panic disorders for nearly 14 years before I sought treatment.  After six months on this drug I was almost back to normal.  Combined with two years of therapy
column3: I could function normally.  I have been on this drug for nearly 20 years with no side effects. This drug has been a life saver for me.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$4$Imipramine has given me long term relief from depression
column3: having taken it for 18 years. I started treatment with SSRI's then later my dr. added imipramine

column6: making depression worse at the end. Took imipramine along and had better results with tri-cyclic.

45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I had suffered with anxiety and depression for many years on and off.  Then during a very difficult time I no longer could manage.  I started taking this med.  It took about 3 months before I received the full benefit.  I was on this drug from 1994 until 2003 (I was afraid to go off of it).  I have never gone back to depression and crippling anxiety like I had before taking imipramine.  It is now 6 years since my last dose... I feel as though I was thrown a life line... life is good!

column1: 101$Depression$10/19/2009 6:20:05 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$4$3$

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$This is the only antidepressant that has ever worked for me. I have tried all of the SSRIs with negative result. I am currently on 75mg a day. I don't like the bad taste in my mouth or the sweating or constipation; however I am willing to deal with them. I take stool softener and drink lots of water
column4: and use breath mints/breath spray. I was very
column5: very depressed. Imipramine has been a godsend for me.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$5$I've been using this drug most of the time since 1981. Without it
column3: I'm barely functional because of depression. I've tried other anti-depressants
column6: but they don't do the job as well. I'm currently taking 150 mg @ bedtime. Side effects are unable to tolerate extreme heat/humidity combination
column8: and if I forget to dose
column9: I feel like crap the next day
column10: and have little (brain tweeks?) of and on through the day
column11: but can correct these if I half dose in the morning.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$My GP prescribed this for me to take at bedtime so that I would have a better night's sleep and wake up feeling refreshed (and also for mild depression). As far as my sleep goes
column3: it doesn't really help me sleep any better (doesn't make it worse either)
column4: but I do wake up feeling well-rested. The best part about it? For me
column5: it has decreased my appetite so much that I haven't eaten a meal in 4 days (I just started taking it a week ago). I have to force myself to eat a cracker or a piece of bread just so I have something in my stomach. I have lost 7 pounds in a week!! I know it's not the best way to lose weight
column6: but why fight it? I need to lose 25 pounds anyway! I don't know if it actually helps with depression
column7: but if I lose 25 pounds I probably won't be so depressed anymore.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $1$1$1$I asked the doctor to take me off of this med.  I had ringing in my ears

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have taken this drug for a number of years and I am quite satisfied with it.  My doctor prescribed other meds to replace this but I noticed nothing else was as effective and this med.

25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $1$1$1$"My husband took this medication at the age of 10-12. He started having auditory and visual halusinations. Tremors of the hands and legs. And many other problems. He was taken off the medication. He is 29 now. But after this medication
column3: he never lost the ""voices and visuals"" nor the tremors. Because of the voices and visuals. He is now ""schizophrenic"". His doctor said these will never go away. Please dont put your children on this medication!"

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$3$3$ I was taking 75mg a day to help with Bipolar Disorder/ADHD along with 54mg Concerta and 100mg of Seroquel. I stopped taking this medication several months ago with mixed feelings due to side effects I felt threatened my health. I do feel abit down and compulsive without it though. I delt with major constipation
column4: a strange metallic taste in my mouth
column5: and a huge decrease in urine output. It was as if my body would no longer tell me I needed to go. It gave me a big sweet tooth.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$5$Imipramine has worked better than anything else for my serious psychiatric problems. I've been on it most of my life. The imipramine pamoate formulation seems to smooth out the side effects-tremor and dry mouth especially. The old tricyclic antidepressants have the spectrum of action of the new SNRIs and are much cheaper.

19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$3$"A couple years ago
column3: I was given this as an addition to my zoloft.  I tried it for a couple weeks
column4: but I couldn't stay on it.  I don't remember whether it helped my anxiety or depression
column5: but I remember the side effects.

column1: My muscles felt like I had the flu.  They would get fatigued very quickly.  They other thing is that my memory was totally shot.  I couldn't recall simple words that I use all the time.  I know that happens to everyone once in a while
column2: but this was extreme.  It would happen 5 times in the same conversation.  I'd have to stop in the middle of a sentence and try to explain the definition of the word to the person I was speaking to.

column1: May be a great for someone else
column2: but it just didn't work for me."
